frameDefinitions: This frame has to do with the repetition (and especially the frequency of repetition) of an event.
Ambient conditions of temperature, precipitation, windiness, and sunniness pertain at a certain Place and Time.
An Experiencer feels an emotion as evoked as an Other.
An Entity changes, either in its category membership, its situation, or in terms of the quality of an Attribute.
A relation holds between Entity_1 and Entity_2.
The words in this frame involve an Undesirable_event which affects the Patient negatively.
frameExamples: China will have to face a high <t>frequency</t> of sand storms in the years to come.
One might <t>pity</t> the frail old man in East Berlin.
As soon as Tiffany kissed the frog, Tiffany <t>turned</t> into a frog.
I see no <t>relation</t> between these animals.
The first <t>calamity</t> was a disastrous trade war with Holland.
listRoleDefinitions: This role is used for any (bounded) <fen>Event</fen> whose frequency or iteration is described.
The extent to which the actually observed rate of occurrence of the <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> differs from the expected rate.
The <fen>Interval</fen> is a noun modified by the target word. The target word specifies the frequency of the <fen>Interval</fen> .
The <fen>Time_span</fen> is the length of time of the <fen>Interval</fen>. This role is incorporated by most of the lexical units in this frame.
The number of times per unit of real or scanning time that an <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is encountered.
An entity which the implicit cognizer encounters with the specified frequency.
The frequency feature of the <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is under discussion. All the lexical units in this frame incorporate this frame element.
The Time when the Event has a particular frequency.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the weather occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the weather occurs.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Other</fen> is the person that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The  <fen>Situation</fen> is the circumstances or topic about which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels an emotion.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels for the <fen>Other</fen>.
The concrete or abstract entity that undergoes a change.
The type of <fen>Entity</fen> that results from the change.
The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to before it undergoes the change.
The value of the <fen>Attribute</fen> before the change takes place.
The quality of the <fen>Attribute</fen> that results from the change.
A characteristic of the <fen>Entity</fen> for which a quality can be assigned or determined by calculation, measurement, or observation.

The <fen>Initial_value</fen> and <fen>Final_value</fen> taken together as the range through which the <fen>Entity</fen> changes.

The main faith of the church has <t>changed</t> <fex name='val'>between Orthodox, Protestant and Greek Catholic</fex> several times.
The <fen>Entity</fen>'s situation that results from the change.
The situation that the <fen>Entity</fen> began in.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> undergoes the transformation.
The location that the change takes place.
An entity with a relationship to <fen>Entity_2</fen>.
The entity with a relationship to <fen>Entity_1</fen>.
The things that are related to each other. Collective expression of the FEs <fen>Entity_1</fen> and <fen>Entity_2</fen>.
A characterization of the relation that determines what model is active for further reasoning.
The undesirable event which occurs.
The entity that experiences the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen>.
When the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen> occurs.
Where the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen> takes place.
listRoleExamples: The country has been struck by frequent <fex>economic crises</fex>.
The Crested Lark (Galerida cristata) is  <fex>very</fex> frequent from the coastal plain to the mountains.
The meetings occurred at fortnightly <fex>intervals</fex>.
You have to renew the license every <fex>year</fex> .
The state government spends its fiscal year 2006 budget of $23.4 billion at a rate <fex>of $742 per second</fex>.
It costs about US$2.50 to travel 200km (124 mi), but <fex>buses</fex> are infrequent and only one or two buses a day service most routes.
These exposures were likely to be intermittent <fex>in frequency</fex> occurring only when workers were participating in activities at these specific areas.
How pleasing to see that <fex>Martha</fex> has changed now.
The viccar changed <fex>from a professional clergyman</fex> into an anti-ecclesiastical activist.
At that time, my asthma changed <fex>from very mild</fex> to severe.
Its color changed from red <fex>to blue</fex>.
Test to check if <fex>the color</fex> changes when you place your mouse over the JavaScript image
Tests went from taking three hours <fex>to needing less than one</fex> .
She slowly shifted <fex>from giving him makework</fex> to actually finding he had some skills .
<fex>Then</fex> she turned into a lizard.
<fex>This topic</fex> has no relation to the matter at hand.
This topic has no relation <fex>to the matter at hand</fex>.
The relation <fex>between these data sets</fex> is not clear to me.
There is a <fex>kinship</fex> relation between them .
An <fex>environmental</fex> disaster is just what we need.
